intro: Oenothera decorticans, commonly known as the sea bladder or sea spurge, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of the United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble bladders. The plant typically grows in sandy or saline soils and is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with four petals, and bloom in the evening. Oenothera decorticans is often found in dunes and salt marshes, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and supporting local ecosystems.
